basics.name: Judy McNeil
basics.label: Sr. Program Manager
basics.summary: Dedicated program manager with a strong background in engineering and teaching, currently leading initiatives at Microsoft to create technical learning content. Leveraging hands-on engineering experience, I navigate complex projects with precision. My teaching background enhances communication skills, ensuring the creation of engaging and accessible content. Committed to staying current with industry trends, I collaborate effectively with clients, making informed decisions to drive programs towards cutting-edge solutions.

work.name: Carvana
work.summary: Starting as the first Application Security Engineer at the company, responsible for building the application security team and program at Carvana.
highlights: Created a Security Champion program that includes designing and running secure code training for engineers in a quarter long cohort.
Built a subdomain takeover scanner which successfully detected over 50 vulnerable subdomains since it's launch.
Implemented security tooling to perform SAST, SCA, and Secret Scanning on build pipelines leveraging Security Champions.
Built automation around the security tools that automatically provisions access to Security Champions that complete the cohort.
Manage the bug bounty program, keeping the brief up to date and replicating reports as necessary.

work.name: Atlassian
work.summary: Worked on an application security team whose focus was applications and plugins in the market ecosystem.
highlights: Upgraded existing scanner to check againt published security standards.
Worked on the bug bounty program that we maintained for all bug bounty submissions against third party apps and pugins.

work.name: Trilogy Education
work.summary: Taught an introductory class with around 25 stuents that was 24-weeks long and covered a broad range of information security topics.
highlights: Took learners from zero-to-hero, starting with linux and command-line and ending with a lab in the cloud that contained security monitoring, a vulnerable web application, and cloud security tooling.

work.name: Optiv
work.summary: Worked as a senior application security consultant and primarily performed web application security assessments.
highlights: Created a demonstration of Log4Shell vulnerability shortly after it was discovered and shared this content with the greater team to assist in any consulting work related to Log4Shell
Worked regularly with a small Credit Union client to help improve their application security by introducing and managing security tooling such as SAST and SCA.
Performed multiple application security assessments on client applications that included banking and finance, clinical, and social applications
Worked with a large security networking technology company to improve their secrets-in-source-code scanning and vulnerability management automation.

work.name: Zoom Video Communications
work.summary: Primarily focused on the Static Analysis and Security Champion program.
highlights: Implemented Checkmarx as an On-Prem SAST solution by assessing resource needs and building out the infrastructure for the scanners and webserver.

Created a SAST Program by designing remediation workflows, creating responsibility documentation for Security Champions, and the design and implementation of automation that synced security tool results with our vulnerability management system.
Created metrics on security champion activity in the SAST platform to measure engagement and remediation efforts.

work.name: Starbucks
work.summary: Started by creating a Vulnerability Management team and then moved on to join the Global Applicaiton Security team.
highlights: Built vulnerability management automation that leveraged an internal systems, including Active Directory, to enrich vulnerability data with business context and ownership.
Implemented and contributed to open-source OWASP Project Defect Dojo to aggrigate application security findings to a single tool.
Assisted other security teams, such as the Mobile Device Management (MDM) team in creating automation for mass deployments of apps and web-surveys to in-store devices across US and Canada.

volunteer.summary: An Open Source application security tool used for aggrigating, organization, and prioritizing application security findings from assessments and tools.
highlights: Overhauled the JIRA integration
Improved the formatting of findings imported from Blackduck and Fortify tools.
